alert.note: Alert for Cave Creek, New River; Mazatzal Mountains; New River Mesa; Rio Verde, Salt River (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 14 at 2:47PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Gila and Maricopa Counties through 345 PM MST... At 246 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles southeast of Black Canyon City to near Horseshoe Reservoir. These storms were nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Scottsdale, New River, Cave Creek, Carefree, Desert Mountain, Camp Creek, Horseshoe Reservoir and Seven Springs. This includes AZ Interstate 17 between mile markers 231 and 241. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Cave Creek, New River; Mazatzal Mountains; New River Mesa; Rio Verde, Salt River
